isis.stitle: Meritor/WABCO Hydraulic ABS for Medium-Duty Trucks, Buses and Motor Home Chassis - COMPONENT REPLACEMENT - Sensors

svcsubproc.title: Sensor Lube Specification
svcsubproc.para: Meritor WABCO specifications call for a sensor lubricant with the following characteristics:

Lube must be mineral oil-based and contain molydisulfide. It should have excellent anti-corrosion and adhesion characteristics and be capable of continuous function in a temperature range of -40° to 300°F (-40° to 150°C).

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Replacement - Front Axle

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip and fall over. Serious personal injury can result.

caution.para: To avoid damage to the electrical system or ABS components, when welding on an ABS-equipped vehicle disconnect the power connector from the ECU.

step1.para: Apply the parking brakes. Chock the rear tires to prevent vehicle movement.
If necessary, raise the front tires off the ground. Put safety stands under the axle.
Disconnect the fasteners that hold the sensor cable to other components.
Disconnect the sensor cable from the chassis harness.
Remove the sensor from the sensor holder. Twist and pull the sensor to remove it from the sensor bracket. Do not pull on the cable.

item.para: Connect the sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Install the fasteners used to hold the sensor cable in place.
Apply a Meritor WABCO-recommended lubricant to the sensor spring clip and sensor.
Install the sensor spring clip. Make sure the spring clip tabs are on the inboard side of the vehicle.
With the tabs on the inboard side, push the sensor spring clip into the bushing in the steering knuckle until the clip stops.
Push the sensor completely into the sensor spring clip until it contacts the tooth wheel.
Fasten the sensor cable with tie wraps every 12 inches. Properly bundle and store excess cable in the sub frame.
Remove the blocks and safety stands.
Perform a voltage output check to ensure proper installation. Refer to "Sensor Output Voltage Test."

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Replacement - Rear Axle

item.para: Apply the parking brake. Chock the front tires to prevent vehicle movement.
Raise the rear tires off of the ground. Put safety stands under the axle.
If the rear tire must be removed to gain access to the sensor, release the parking brake to release the brake shoe.
Remove the wheel and tire assembly from the axle.
Remove the sensor from the mounting block in the axle housing. Use a twisting motion if necessary. Do not pull on the cable.
Disconnect the sensor cable from the chassis harness.
Remove the sensor cable from any cable clamps or clips.
Remove the sensor spring clip from the sensor bracket.
Connect the new sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Press the sensor spring clip into the sensor bracket, located on the rear axle, until it stops. Make sure the tabs are on the inboard side.
Apply a Meritor WABCO-recommended lubricant to the sensor.
Push the sensor completely into the spring clip until it contacts the tooth wheel.
Reattach the sensor cable to the cable clamps or clips.
Fasten the sensor cable with tie wraps every 12 inches. Properly bundle and store excess cable in the sub frame.
Replace the tire, remove the safety stands, lower the vehicle and remove the chocks from the front tires.
Perform a voltage output check to ensure proper installation. Refer to "Sensor Output Voltage Test."
